objective.answer: The primary objective of the paper is to introduce a new type of graph structure called the text-numeric graph (TNG) and propose integrating large language models (LLMs) and graph neural networks (GNNs) to analyze these graphs for scientific discovery.
objective.evidence: In this study, we introduce a new type of graph structure, the text-numeric graph (TNG), which is defined as graph entities and associations have both text-attributed information and numeric information. We further propose integrating large language models (LLMs) and graph neural networks (GNNs) to analyze the TNGs for graph understanding and reasoning.

knowledge_gap.answer: Existing graph-based reasoning models are limited to either text-attributed or numeric-attributed graphs, which is inefficient for real-world scientific knowledge discoveries that require integration of both textual and numeric data.
knowledge_gap.evidence: A major limitation of the current existing graph-based reasoning is that they are developed for either text-attributed or numeric-attributed graphs. It is not consistent with and not efficient for the real-world scientific knowledge discoveries.

answer: Introduction of the text-numeric graph (TNG) structure that integrates text and numeric data for scientific discovery.
Development of joint LLM-GNN models for analyzing TNGs to improve classification accuracy and network inference.
Application of the proposed models to text-omic signaling graphs (TOSG) using single-cell RNAseq datasets.
evidence: Herein, we introduce a new type of graph structure, the text-numeric graph (TNG), which is defined as graph entities and associations have both text-attributed information and numeric information.
We proposed joint LLM-GNN models for key entity mining and signaling pathway mining on the TOSGs.

To demonstrate the utility, we generated the text-omic(numeric) signaling graphs (TOSG), as one type of TNGs, in which all graphs have the same entities, associations and annotations, but have sample-specific entity numeric (omic) values using single cell RNAseq (scRNAseq) datasets of different diseases.

inspirational_papers.answer: - Feng et al. (2024) PathFinder: a novel graph transformer model to infer multi-cell intra- and inter-cellular signaling pathways and communications. (Methodological precursors)
inspirational_papers.evidence: We compare our work with random forests, multilayer perceptron, convolutional networks, and our models from previous phases. We find that our model significantly outperforms all other models, including the model we developed in the previous phase.
